quote: The open-source Python library MIScnn is a framework to setup medical image segmentation pipelines with convolutional neural networks and deep learning models.

The already implemented models are highly configurable by definable number of neurons, custom input sizes, optional dropout and batch normalization layers or enhanced architecture versions like the Optimized High Resolution Dense-U-Net model.
MIScnn features an open model interface to load and switch between provided state-of-the-art convolutional neural network models like the popular U-Net model.
Additionally, MIScnn offers architectures for 3D, as well as 2D medical image segmentation.
The Sigmoid value represents a probability estimation of this pixel for the associated label.
The model predicts for every pixel a Sigmoid value for each class.
The goal of the KiTS19 challenge is the development of reliable and unbiased kidney and kidney tumor semantic segmentation methods.
Nevertheless, it was possible to build a powerful pipeline for kidney tumor segmentation with MIScnn resulting into a model with high performance.
The standard 3D U-Net with batch normalization layers were used as deep learning and convolutional neural network model.
The fitted model achieved a very strong performance for kidney segmentation.
with just a few lines of codes using the MIScnn framework, it was possible to successfully build a powerful pipeline for medical image segmentation.
the MIScnn road map includes the model library extension with more state-of-the-art deep learning models for medical image segmentation.
Deep 3D Convolutional Encoder Networks With Shortcuts for Multiscale Feature Integration Applied to Multiple Sclerosis Lesion Segmentation.
